results.title: The Photo conductive effect
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Frank A. Hoare, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Katrina Rank
results.brief_description: Shows how the photo-conductive cell is highly sensitive to infra-red radiation. Illustrates various methods of detecting and measuring such radiation; history of research into the photo-conductive effect - Willoughby Smith’s experiments and Adam’s and Day’s work; composition of a photo-conductive cell and its working; the distance in spectral response curve between the different substances; operation of guided missiles, steel furnaces, and medical analysis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cons, Frank A. Hoare, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Katrina Rank

results.title: The Philippines: two girls
results.creator_credit: Soerabaia Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”
Shows the life of an Australian girl aged nine years living in the Philippines and contrasts it with that of a seventeen year old Filipino girl who is aiming at being a physical education teacher.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Philippines: the furthest cross
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Roan Hannam, Don Murray, John Temple, University of Queensland Press, Film Australia and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of the Philippines. A well-photographed and interesting documentary. Photography by Dean Semler. Unit Manager Damien Parer.

results.title: The Philippines: talking pictures
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”
Filipino children’s paintings are intercut with live action showing aspects of the Philippines. The children responsible for the art work provide the commentary.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Philippines: island republic
results.brief_description: The Philippines is a multi-island republic, with about half of its 7000 islands inhabited. Under the colonial rule of the United States, the democratic system of government was introduced, universal public education, and an all-weather road system. Reviews the agriculture, and economy of the islands and points out the relative prosperity.

results.title: The Philippines: finding water
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
An Australian drilling supervisor and his crew and a Filipino water diviner go to work in the yard of a village school in the Philippines. The children’s observations are recorded. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Philippines. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
The Philippines is a nation of over a hundred ethnic groups and since ancient times it has been a major trading partner for the Asian world. This two part video starts off in Manila and its surrounds as we explore the historic sites and buildings left behind by the island’s Spanish and American colonisers. From Manila we travel to the opulent Coconut Palace of the Marcos Regime and observe a bizarre flagellation and crucifixion rite that occurs every Easter. In the second part of the video we explore some of the multitude of islands that make up the Philippines, including Cebu and the beautiful natural paradises of Badian and Dakak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup

results.title: The Philadelphia story (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A wealthy society girl, who is about to marry for the second time, finds she still loves her first husband. This witty and sophisticated romantic comedy features a sparkling screenplay, great performances and has a well-deserved reputation as a Hollywood “screwball” classic. With Katherine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart. Based on a play by Philip Barry and the inspiration for the musical “High Society”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Cukor, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.description: A wealthy society girl, who is about to marry for the second time, finds she still loves her first husband. results.title: The Philadelphia Story
results.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A wealthy society girl, who is about to marry for the second time, finds she still loves her first husband. Cukor’s direction is so discreet you can hardly sense it. Starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart. Based on a play by Philip Barry.
